repnme.cdata!:
Jamaica - Water Supply and Sewerage
            Technical Assistance and Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The primary objectives of the Water
            Supply and Sewerage Technical Assistance and Rehabilitation
            Project are to strengthen NWC's financial/commercial,
            institutional and operational capabilities and to ensure
            that additional takeovers of parish council water supply
            systems are accomplished in an orderly manner. More
            specifically, the project seeks to reduce the sector's
            dependence on Government subsidies; help eliminate
            bottlenecks in the Kingston area water distribution system,
            and rehabilitate neglected water supply and sewerage
            facilities. The project also plans to prepare a medium-term
            investment program for NWC as well as feasibility studies
            for extension of NWC's water and sewerage systems; and
            to investigate and promote the use of low cost and
            appropriate technology, principally for the rural areas. The
            project comprises the following components: (i) technical
            assistance to strengthen management and improve financial
            information and billing systems; and (ii) purchase of
            microcomputers, chlorination equipment, pumps, vehicles,
            emergency generators, and equipment for water supply and
            sewerage operations and maintenance upgrading. Further, the
            project includes; (iii) modernization of workshop and stores
            and elimination of water transmission bottlenecks in Kingston.
